    • Uses of IExhibit in model.interfaces

      Methods in model.interfaces that return IExhibit 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IExhibit IPurchase.getExhibit()
      This method returns the exhibit for which the tickets have been sold.
      Methods in model.interfaces that return types with arguments of type IExhibit 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<IExhibit,ExhibitData> ISalesManagement.getData()
      This method returns the exhibits data related to the management of the ticket office.
      java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<IExhibit,java.lang.Double>> IClassification.getList()
      This method returns the list of Entry from IExhibit to Double.
      Methods in model.interfaces with parameters of type IExhibit 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ISalesManagement.addExhibit(IExhibit ex)
      This method adds a new exhibit to the map which stores the exhibits data related to the management of the ticket office.
      int ISalesManagement.getAvailableTickets(IExhibit ex)
      Given the exhibit, this method returns the number of available tickets.
      boolean ISalesManagement.isExPresent(IExhibit ex)
      Given the exhibit, this method returns if it is already present in the map.
      double ISalesManagement.purchase(IExhibit ex, double percentage, int number, double price)
      This method models a new purchase, calculating and returning the total.
      Method parameters in model.interfaces with type arguments of type IExhibit 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double IBalance.profit(java.util.Map<IExhibit,java.lang.Double> inc)
      This method calculates and returns the total income at the current date.
      void ISalesManagement.setData(java.util.Map<IExhibit,ExhibitData> m)
      This method sets the map containing the expositions and the related available tickets to the given one.
      void IClassification.sortMap(java.util.Map<IExhibit,java.lang.Double> incomes)
      Given a map from an exhibit to its income, this method creates a list of Entry from IExhibit to Double, sorted using a new Comparator.
